item.title: Machine Learning, Rust and SIMD - I
item.description: In the last post about Botejão, my Telegram Menu Bot, I discussed a feature I would like to add to it: allow the user to see how many people are in the restaurants line. I also mentioned that the university itself would only install and allow the use of the camera if the processing was done on-device and the images never left it. The only output would be how many people are in the line, through an API, for privacy reasons.

item.title: Botejão - A motivation to write Rust
item.description: When learning Rust I started many toy projects. One of them was Botejão. It was never meant to be anything more than a Telegram Bot to check my universities (UNICAMP) daily menu. In the beginning users asked the bot for the menu and then got a reply. Later it got a few upgrades and now it sends the day’s menu every night to a channel. However, I always felt like this bot could do more.

item.title: About me
item.description: I’m just a guy who really likes writing Rust.
